courses.name: HTML  5
courses.description: Learn the basics of HTML5 for structuring web content.
courses.definition: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard language for creating webpages and web applications.
courses.content:
HTML uses tags to structure documents, like

for headings,

for paragraphs, and for links.
courses.content2: It allows embedding images, videos, forms, and interactive content into web pages.
courses.content3: HTML5 introduces semantic elements like <article>, <section>, <header>, and better multimedia support.

courses.name: CSS new
courses.description: Master CSS3 to style modern responsive websites and beautiful UI.
courses.definition: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used to control the presentation, formatting, and layout of web pages.
courses.content: CSS styles HTML elements by applying properties like color, font-size, margins, and positioning.
courses.content2: CSS3 introduced animations, flexbox, grid layout, and responsive design features.
courses.content3: External stylesheets help keep the HTML structure clean and separate content from design.

examples.description: Apply styles based on screen size.

courses.name: JavaScript
courses.description: Understand JavaScript fundamentals and dynamic web development.
courses.definition: JavaScript is a scripting language that enables interactive web pages and dynamic web applications.
courses.content: It can manipulate HTML and CSS, respond to user actions, and communicate with servers.
courses.content2: Popular for form validation, dynamic content updates, animations, and real-time data handling.
courses.content3: Modern JavaScript uses ES6+ features like arrow functions, promises, and async/await.

courses.name: React js
courses.description: Build powerful user interfaces using React.js it is java script library.
courses.definition: React is a JavaScript library for building fast, interactive user interfaces using a component-based architecture.
courses.content: Uses JSX syntax to combine HTML and JavaScript logic in one file.
courses.content2: React components manage their own state and can be reused across applications.
courses.content3: React uses a virtual DOM to optimize rendering performance.

examples.description: Manage local data inside a component.

courses.name: Angular
courses.description: Develop dynamic single-page applications using Angular.
courses.definition: Angular is a TypeScript-based framework for building scalable single-page web applications.
courses.content: It uses a component-based architecture and powerful templating with two-way data binding.
courses.content2: Includes built-in support for routing, forms, HTTP requests, and dependency injection.
courses.content3: Angular CLI simplifies development by generating components, services, and modules.

examples.description: Loop over a list in templates.
Share data and logic across components.

courses.name: Node.js
courses.description: Server-side programming using Node.js and Express it is java script libarary.
courses.definition: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine, used to create scalable server-side applications.
courses.content: Allows running JavaScript code outside the browser, typically on servers.
courses.content2: Commonly used with Express.js to build REST APIs and backend services.
courses.content3: Supports asynchronous programming using callbacks, promises, and async/await.

courses.name: MongoDB
courses.description: Learn NoSQL database design with MongoDB its manage data backend.
courses.definition: MongoDB is a NoSQL database that stores data in flexible, JSON-like documents.
courses.content: It allows dynamic schemas, making it highly scalable and developer-friendly.
courses.content2: Common operations: inserting, updating, deleting, and querying documents.
courses.content3: Mongoose is often used in Node.js apps to model MongoDB data.

courses.name: Python
courses.description: Intro to Python programming for backend and scripting.
courses.definition: Python is a popular, beginner-friendly programming language known for its simplicity and versatility.
courses.content: Commonly used for web development, data science, AI, and automation.
courses.content2: Python uses indentation to define code blocks, promoting clean code.
courses.content3: Popular frameworks: Django, Flask (web development); Pandas, NumPy (data science).

courses.name: MERN Stack
courses.description: Full stack development using MongoDB, Express, React, and Node.
courses.definition: MERN Stack is a full-stack JavaScript solution for building dynamic web applications from front to back.
courses.content: MongoDB handles the database, Express the backend server, React the frontend, and Node.js the runtime.
courses.content2: MERN projects typically involve building REST APIs and connecting them to React UIs.
courses.content3: It enables rapid, scalable, and modern web app development using one programming language: JavaScript.

courses.name: MEAN Stack
courses.description: Full stack development using MongoDB, Express, Angular, and Node.
courses.definition: MEAN Stack is a JavaScript-based framework for building dynamic web applications with Angular in the frontend.
courses.content: MongoDB stores data, Express and Node.js manage the server-side logic, and Angular powers the user interface.
courses.content2: It supports creating powerful, scalable single-page applications (SPA).
courses.content3: MEAN stack provides a highly efficient full-stack JavaScript environment.
